Data.string: A tasty fish from the orcish swamps.
Malt is made out of cereal crops with the help of a malt box. It's then used in a wort boiler to produce wort.
Wort is made by putting malt into a wort boiler.
Yeast is necessary for brewing. It defines a beer's alcoholic strength.
Beer can be sold to visitors via faucets or drunk by yourself.
A piece of junk, mostly found by fishing.
A mysterious treasure chest of unknown origins.
A piece of paper with a scrawly writing. Anyway, it could be useful.
Wood is required for building structures and fueling production machines.
Fiber is a material used in building special structures, like carpet floors.
A piece of heavy stone, mostly used for building structures.
Iron ores are found in stone boulders and molten to iron in furnaces.
Iron is used for building structures, especially production machines.
A dangerous invention. If put in a stone pit, it can be used to generate new stones.
This bottle of medicine helps you to get rid of a sickness.
A piece of tasty pigeon meat.
A pigeon egg. It can be put in a pigeon sleeping box to breed pigeons or in a furnace.
A fried pigeon egg. It smells very deliciously!
A special care package, normally used in war as a kind of emergency ration.
A seed bag with unknown contents.
A lovely Valentine's Day card, brought back by a pigeon.
The bottle is old and the paper already yellowed.
Instead of a reflection, the mirror shows the sky, far beyond the clouds. It has a signature on the back, stating 'Jason Levine Jr.'.
Common orcs think that this is a piece of jewelry. What fools! It has a signature on the back, stating 'Jason Levine Jr.'.
A golden globe. It seems to be hollow and containing things. Perhaps it can be opened? It has a signature on the bottom, stating 'Jason Levine Jr.'.
A special seed bag with mystical ornaments on it. It has a signature on the bottom, stating 'Jason Levine Jr.'.
Hops are mainly used for brewing. They define the beer's bitterness.
Corn is a cereal crop of tier 5 and can be used for brewing but also for baking bread.
Wheat is a cereal crop of tier 4 and can be used for brewing but also for baking bread.
Barley is a cereal crop of tier 1 and can be used for brewing but also for baking bread.
Rye is a cereal crop of tier 3 and can be used for brewing but also for baking bread.
Spelt is a cereal crop of tier 2 and can be used for brewing but also for baking bread.
Blueleaves is a flavor crop of tier 2 and can be used in the beer brewing process.
Belladonna is a flavor crop of tier 1 and can be used in the beer brewing process.
Dryroot is a flavor crop of tier 3 and can be used in the beer brewing process.
Lotus is a flavor crop of tier 5 and can be used in the beer brewing process.
Sunflowers is a flavor crop of tier 4 and can be used in the beer brewing process.
Scholar's Fire is a special flavor crop. If put in a beer, it can replace and satisfy any flavor wish of a clan.
[color=240,176,84]Add a flavor to the brewing process and the beer will have benefits on drinking.[/]
A signature tells that this egg was designed by #.
Raw Material (e.g. Barley, Fish or Iron Ore)
Increases revenues for selling structures, allows to destroy solider stones and stone pits eject rarer stones.
Increases growth speed of plants. Up to level 4, the hawker will sell new plant seeds.
Increases maximal water stored in buckets and rain barrels and increases the time tiles stay wet.
Improves maximal dung stored in the dung bag, the time tiles stay dunged and the production time and storage capacities of composts.
Increases the chance to find better fish and loot.
Increases the chance that plants drop more seeds if let alone and more crops during the plant's main season.
Increases capacity and descreases production time of malt boxes, wort boilers and beer brewing kettles.
Increases storage capacity of chests and barrels.
Decreases costs and increases revenues for trading with the hawker.
Trees grow faster, their wood increases faster in quality and stone pits eject more stones

Long ago, the members of the Ghouls were part of respected clans, forming the rearguard in the vast orcish wars. As success and glory grew within the orcish army, the once respected latecomers degenerated to ghouls, searching the enemies' corpses for valuable loot. Now, the Ghouls are a disgusting pack of vermin.

The Coopers craft barrels and chests of all kind. They are one of the first craftsmen forming a guild. Their financial power ensured wealth and influence in the orcish politics. Anyway, they are often underestimated by the other craft guilds.

Beyond the other crafts, the guild of blacksmiths is one of the most known and respected craftsmen guilds in the lands. Especially, because smithery plays a major role in the orcish culture which is a synonym for war. Across the major clans, every smith has to be part of this guild.

Like the name let one assume, the Spearhead is a clan which provides foolhardy warriors for the front line. They could have something like family related tradition, but because of the low expectancy of life, they recruit foreign orcs in tremendous dimensions.

This clan spread fear and trepidation during the civil war. They performed a bloody inquisition against the defeated, and after they were smoked out, against themselves. They call themselves the twisted dragon who clasps his enemies. The people just call them the hydra who bites off her own heads.
The War Chant clan's purpose is to shape and exercise the orcish musical side. Their war songs are famous and played a lot, whether it is a calm social gathering or on the bloody battlegrounds.

The Miners are from a despised caste of workers. They dig for valuable resources and unearth the minerals the whole orcish crafting culture relies on. In the recent years, the big community of miners has been getting more and more restive and aggressive.

The Berserker clan provides the manpower for the orcish forces. They are under the control of the current ruling warlord. Orcs, who strive for a simple life with an assured income normally overrun to this clan, if they were not already born in it.

Eye of Mind is a coalition of shamans across the country. Their main purpose is to call old ghosts and to bind them to objects, mainly artifacts. Some of the shamans partake in dubious practices and if a descendant didn't liked his parents that much, the deceased father or mother could end as a living faucet on the black market.

Like no other clan, the Historian clan forms the building staff of the orcish society, tutoring young orcs to scholars. Beyond that, they write down the orcish history. These chronicles are stored and are public available in the capital's library.
The Raven Covenant is a discreet and secretive organizations which main purpose is kept in the dark, too. Battle-scarred and political motivated, they may be the puppet masters behind the curtain.

As an old and stable clan, the Fishermen can look back on a long and flourish tradition. The fishers' handcraft is pursued with a lot of proud and tight regulations. Devotees of this lifestyle have to come along with a lot of courage: the orcish swamps can be scarier and more dangerous then every battleground out there.

Yes, the hawkers are organized in a kind of Hawker clan, while still partially belonging to their original clans. The clan regulates prices, trading zones and tolls. Part of their income is taxed and in return, they enjoy a certain degree of neutrality among the clans.

The Spirit Brew clan is a shaman circle which specialized on brewing and cooking. While they work wonders in their kettles from time to time, they are often mistrusted and excluded from the overall social life. As a result, they often live isolated in the woods and visit nearby towns only for trading.

The First Scouts clan shakes the boundaries of the orcish world over and over again. Expedition ships and a rich and extensive library of maps are their fundamentals and their lines are filled with enthusiastic orcs.

The Backbone clan is a colloquial label of the orcish lumberjacks out there, because they are metaphorical the backbone of the orcish empire. Without their strength and knowledge of building wood chopping machines, the orcs would still live in thin tents instead of huge orcish cities.
CLANS WITH PERMISSION WILL VISIT YOUR INN
NO CLAN WILL VISIT YOUR INN
HERE IS ALREADY AN OVERGROUND PIPE
HERE IS ALREADY AN UNDERGROUND PIPE
NOT POSSIBLE IN PIPE DISPLAY MODE

An [color=66,255,128]introductional scenario[/] with a pre-defined map, a basic tavern setup, a tutorial and many resources. Choose this if it's your first time playing Orcish Inn. [color=66,255,128]Existing tutorial save games get overwritten![/]

A [color=66,255,128]challenging scenario[/] for experienced Orcish Inn players with a semi-randomized map generation, no tavern setup, no tutorial and little resources. More basic layouts and random elements will come in the future! [color=66,255,128]Existing challenge save games get overwritten![/]
[color=178,153,164]Wood[/] is required for building all kind of stuff and fueling production. Chop down grown trees and stumps with your hammer-axe to get wood.

[color=132,167,189]Stone[/] is used for building and obtained through smashing stones. If you run out of stones to smash, buy dynamite from the hawker and throw it into the stone pit. If a stone can be smashed depends on the level of your hammer-axe.
[color=167,176,154]Iron[/] is used for building and made out of iron ores obtained from smashed stones and melted in a furnace.
[color=167,205,203]Fiber[/] is used for decorating your inn and gathered by planting and harvesting cotton.

[color=240,176,84]Money[/] is used to buy all sorts of things, from interior up to seeds. Your main income is selling beer to your guests. But be aware: if you collapse due to starvation or exhaustion, you lose further money!
[color=84,240,98]Reputation[/] is gained by satisfying the incoming guests with beer which met their tastes. You can spend the reputation on upgrades.
[color=240,84,84]Social Rank[/] is increased by one for every clan if they reach a certain amount of satisfaction

Open the [color=167,95,255]Hub Book[/] by clicking here or pressing [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,98,395,48,45][/] . It shows the clans visiting your inn and their tastes as well as the upgrades you can perform.

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,245,441,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=76,180,246]Wetness[/] map on or off. Wetness is high near water and can be modified by the weather and increased by using the water bucket.

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,294,441,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=236,226,112]Eutrophy[/] map on or off. Eutrophy is modified by the weather and increased by using the dung bag after producing dung with a compost.

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,343,441,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=234,123,244]Windbreak[/] map on or off. Windbreak is high near objects and modified by weather. Place fences or stone walls to modify the windbreak of a certain area.

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,441,441,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=76,246,104]Plant Density[/] map on or off. Plant Density is high near plants. If seeds like a high plant density, put them together!

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,490,441,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=170,170,170]Optimality[/] map on or off. Having the seed pouch equipped and a seed selected, this map shows the optimal places for this plant.

Click or hold [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,686,395,48,45][/] to toggle the [color=170,170,170]Additional Interface[/] map on or off, like the current filling level of storages or the visitors' clan emblems.
[color=75,245,211]Dawn[/] of day #! Sleeping during dawn refills your stamina only slowly.
[color=75,255,126]Midday[/] of day #! Sleeping during midday refills your stamina extremely slowly.
[color=255,150,93]Dusk[/] of day #! You are getting a bit exhausted over time, but sleeping during dusk refills your stamina.
[color=75,168,255]Night[/] of day #! You are getting exhausted over time, but sleeping during night refills your stamina extremely fast.
[color=93,196,255]Satiation[/] drops with every use of your tools but can be refilled by eating. If you starve, you wake up in your bed with some of your money stolen.

[color=116,255,145]Stamina[/] drops over time during dusk and night as well as with every use of your tools. Sleeping in a bed refills it as well as participating in amusing activities like fishing. If you are totally exhausted, you wake up in your bed with some of your money stolen.

[color=255,222,108]Drunkenness[/] is refilled by drinking beer and drops over time, often granting a bonus dependent on the beer's flavor. If you drink multiple beers of the same type, the duration is combined and the strongest effect applied.

The pigeon gains experience over time if not hungry, not tired and not locked in the sleeping box. With enough experience, it increases in level. For each level up, you can improve the pigeon's skills.
Currently this clan (with # visitors) is [color=55,244,126]allowed[/] to visit the inn (if the tavern is opened). Click to recall the permission.
Currently this clan (with # visitors) [color=255,66,66]isn't allowed[/] to visit your inn. Click to grant them the permission.

Click or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,98,441,48,45][/] to switch through the different pipe system visualizations, including "hidden, "pipes only" and "pipes and production". Legend:|[padding=0,0,0,3][scale=0.75,true,false][icon=8,280,813,18,18][/][/] Input Pipe|[padding=0,0,0,3][scale=0.75,true,false][icon=8,299,813,18,18][/][/] Output Pipe|[padding=0,0,0,3][scale=0.75,true,false][icon=8,318,813,18,18][/][/] Combined Pipe|[padding=0,0,0,1][scale=0.75,true,false][icon=8,337,813,24,24][/][/] Production Origin|[scale=0.75,true,false][icon=8,307,832,26,26][/] Production Target|[color=66,255,208]Colored symbols stand for underground pipes.[/]
Hold [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,931,395,48,45][/] to transfer #1x or [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,0,533,48,45][/] to transfer #2x.
This production doesn't have a cooking recipe for which it trys to produce for. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to set a recipe.

This production currently trys to create products for the selected cooking recipe called [color=167,95,255]#[/]. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to open the cooking recipe book and select another recipe or close it immediately to remove the recipe.
The production is currently active and will produce, if the materials are available. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to pause.
The production is currently paused. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to unpause.

This object hasn't a beer recipe attached. If you attach a beer recipe, this storage does get only filled automatically with beer specified by the recipe. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to set a recipe.

This object does get only filled automatically with beer specified by the [color=167,95,255]#[/] recipe. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to open the cooking recipe book and select another recipe or close it immediately to remove the recipe
The object is open for input and output from productions and pipes. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to disable automatic inputs.
The object is closed for input and output via productions and pipes. Click with the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] to enable automatic inputs.

Click to toggle the menu.| |Time Played: [color=66,255,128]#2[/]| |[color=66,255,128]Orcish Inn #1[/] created by [color=66,255,128]Steven Colling[/] with music and sound effects by [color=66,255,128]Tilmann 'headchant' Hars[/].| |Official website and contact: [color=66,255,128]http://orcish-inn.stevencolling.com[/] [color=66,255,128]info@stevencolling.com[/]
Click to swap the gender of your character.

Click here or press [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,735,395,48,45][/] or [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,833,395,48,45][/] to show respectively hide the tutorial. This is not available in the challenge scenario.

The following people support me financially via Patreon: [color=66,255,128]FotoN[/], [color=66,255,128]Tabisama[/], [color=66,255,128]Simon Barth[/], [color=66,255,128]The Sandbox Games DataBase[/], [color=66,255,128]Rusty Gear[/], [color=66,255,128]MissLily[/], [color=66,255,128]Pandafro[/], [color=66,255,128]Edward Truscott[/], [color=66,255,128]Cddarain[/], [color=66,255,128]Tuomo Lassila[/], [color=66,255,128]Xenorexian[/], [color=66,255,128]Lewis McReu[/] and [color=66,255,128]jessicabalu[/].
Click to visit a new region until you found one where your want to settle down. This one gets discarded. Loading can take some seconds.
Click to settle down in this region. You can't change it afterwards.
Temporary interface for the clan overview.
The recipe's product is a beer with the properties listed below.
The beer's [color=236,235,120]taste[/]. Available are cereal crops like barley. Click to change the [color=236,235,120]taste[/].

The beer's [color=236,213,120]tint brightness[/], controlled by the amount of water in the malt box. [color=236,213,120]Perform a left click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] [color=236,213,120]to increase and a right click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,60,359,29,35][/] [color=236,213,120]to decrease tint brightness.[/]

The beer's [color=236,120,120]full body[/], controlled by the amount of water in the wort boiler. [color=236,120,120]Perform a left click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] [color=236,120,120]to increase and a right click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,60,359,29,35][/] [color=236,120,120]to decrease full body.[/.

The beer's [color=120,236,128]bitterness[/], controlled by the amount of hop in the beer brewing kettle. [color=120,236,128]Perform a left click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] [color=120,236,128]to increase and a right click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,60,359,29,35][/] [color=120,236,128]to decrease bitterness.[/.

The beer's [color=120,169,236]alcoholic strength[/], controlled by the amount of yeast in the beer brewing kettle. [color=120,169,236]Perform a left click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] [color=120,169,236]to increase and a right click[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,60,359,29,35][/] [color=120,169,236]to decrease alcoholic strength.[/
The beer's optional [color=194,120,236]flavor[/]. Available are special flavor crops like Belladonna. Click to change the [color=194,120,236]flavor[/].
Hold the left mouse button [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,30,359,29,35][/] some seconds to delete this recipe.
Create a new recipe for this category.
Move the recipe up in the list.
Move the recipe down in the list.
Select a fitting recipe and click on the [icon=39,311,503,19,19] button to attach it to the object. Select the attached recipe and click the [icon=39,331,503,19,19] button to remove it.
Attach this recipe to the object.
Remove this recipe from the object.
[color=59,243,237]Click here to increase this skill with one of your # skill point(s).[/]
[color=59,243,237]Frugality:[/] Decreases the time until the pigeon has to eat something.
[color=59,243,237]Perseverance:[/] Decreases the time until the pigeon has to go to sleep.
[color=59,243,237]Curiosity:[/] Decreases the time until the pigeon starts another exploration tour.
[color=59,243,237]Libido:[/] Decreases the time until the pigeon is ready for breeding.
[color=59,243,237]Happiness:[/] Increases the happiness the pigeon gains over time.
[color=59,243,237]Fountain of Youth:[/] Increases the time the pigeon lives.
[color=59,243,237]Cognitive Capacities:[/] Increases the amount of experience the pigeon gains over time.
[color=59,243,237]Gatherer:[/] Increases the chance that the pigeon finds rare loot on exploration tours.
[color=59,243,237]Super Genotype:[/] Increases the chance that the pigeon's offsprings get high skill values at their birth.
[color=59,243,237]High Quality:[/] Increases the chance that the pigeon leaves high quality eggs and meat.
[color=59,243,237]Resistance:[/] Increases the chance of the pigeon to survive bad weather.
[color=251,162,84]Open Sleeping Box:[/] The bound pigeon can leave the sleeping box.
[color=251,162,84]Close Sleeping Box:[/] If the bound pigeon is inside the box, it can't leave it, but the bound pigeon and other pigeons can still enter.
[color=251,162,84]Ringing the Bell:[/] The bound pigeon will fly back to this sleeping box.
[color=251,162,84]Bound Pigeon:[/] Bounds a pigeon to this sleeping box so it can be controlled and investigated here.
[color=251,162,84]Unbound Pigeon:[/] Unbound a pigeon so it follows you. It can be bound to another sleeping box then.
[color=251,162,84]Explore![/] If the curiosity is high enough, you can let the pigeon start an exploration tour.
[color=251,162,84]Breed![/] If the libido is high enough, you can let the pigeon start to search for a breeding partner.
[color=251,162,84]Die! Now![/] Hold the left mouse button for some seconds to kill the pigeon and let it drop some meat.

[color=251,162,84]Activate Automatic Search for Food:[/] The pigeon will then search for feeding boxes on its own, if hungry and not locked in this sleeping box. Eating from the sleeping box is not influenced by this.
[color=251,162,84]Deactivate Automatic Search for Food:[/] The pigeon won't search for feeding boxes on its own then and will search for food in this sleeping box instead.
[color=251,162,84]Activate Automatic Search for Love:[/] The pigeon will then search for breeding partners on its own, if ready.
[color=251,162,84]Deactivate Automatic Search for Love:[/] The pigeon won't search for breeding partners on its own then.
[color=251,162,84]Activate Automatic Search for Loot:[/] The pigeon will then start exploration tours on its own, if ready.
[color=251,162,84]Deactivate Automatic Search for Loot:[/] The pigeon won't start exploration tours on its own then.

[color=58,174,255]Satiation:[/] Drops over time and is refilled by eating crops (like barley) from the sleeping box or a feeding box. If the satiation is too low, the pigeon can't fly out for exploration tours, breed or gain experience. Furthermore, curiosity, libido and happiness don't increase until the pigeon is fed.

[color=58,255,148]Stamina:[/] Drops over time and is refilled by staying in the sleeping box. If the stamina is too low, the pigeon can't fly out for exploration tours, breed or gain experience. Furthermore, curiosity, libido and happiness don't increase until the pigeon is rested.

[color=255,197,58]Curiosity:[/] Increases over time if not locked in the sleeping box, hungry or tired. If full, the pigeon makes an exploration tour and will bring back a random item. The Gatherer skill and the current happiness decide the rarity of the found loot and the type of the recent food the loot's quality (higher crop tiers like wheat result in a higher quality than something like barley).

[color=255,108,108]Libido:[/] Increases over time if not locked in the sleeping box, hungry or tired. If full, the pigeon searchs for a breeding partner. Both pigeons have to be ready and of different gender. The Super Genotype skill and the current happiness of both pigeons decide how many skills the child will get at birth and the High Quality skill decides the egg's quality (if you want to eat it...).

[color=255,108,255]Happiness:[/] Increases over time if satiated and rested. It also depends on the quality of the recently eaten crops and the Happiness skill. The happiness affects exploration tours, breeding and many more.
[color=150,150,150]Age:[/] Drops over time and if empty, the pigeon will die. Pigeons can also die during bad weather.
[color=255,109,109]The pigeon strikes until you feed it![/]
[color=255,109,109]The pigeon strikes until it gets some sleep![/]
The pigeon does nothing special right now.
The pigeon sits in the sleeping box.
The pigeon searchs for food in a feeding box.
The pigeon makes an exploration tour.
Satiation is restored over time (level #l).|[color=229,157,53]#d left.[/]
Stamina is restored over time (level #l).|[color=229,157,53]#d left.[/]
You are over-worked. Working consumes more satiation and stamina. Put up with it or buy medicine from the hawker.|[color=229,157,53]#d left[/]
You are drunk. Add flavor (like Belladonna) to the beer to gain further bonuses!|[color=229,157,53]#d left[/]
press left # to switch back to the game
press right # to switch back to the game
A fresh breeze and the warmth of the fire...
The weather got better, didn't it?
... and then I started trading seeds and useful stuff.
I added this place to my daily route.
I sell seeds. Do you need any?
I give you seeds, you give me the grown outcome and we both win.
The yeast I have is necessary for brewing beer.
Only good quality yeast will lead to good quality beer.
If you ran out of food, I can sell you some bread.
If you have anything left, you can sell it to me.
I crashed into a tree. Multiple times. I think that's just normal.
I see a flourish tavern in my mind's eye.
I'm a hawker, dashing through the sky.
Only the sky is the limit. That should be everyone's philosophy.
You should look around. The nature has its own secrets, worth to be discovered.
... and then... wait, I already said something like this.
Thank you #1 for trading with me!
Out of my way trees, here I come!
Tasty seeds, delicious yeast, every shit from west to east!
GO AWAY BIRD! LET ME FLY!
Where are you? I have seeds and yeast to sell!
I normally don't yell, but: HERE I COME!
Here comes your opportunity to buy and sell stuff!
As every midday, here I am!
Here I come and here I will stay. Until dusk.
A new day, a new chance to buy seeds, yeast and food!
The flying hawker on his way!
DASHING THROUGH THE TREES! DASHING THROUGH THE SKY!
I will end my tour and tomorrow, I'm back. The only thing which is guaranteed!
Keep your chin up! I'm back tomorrow!
It's dusk and time to go. See you next midday!
I will go for now and next midday, I will come back.
Trading opportunities are over until next midday.
It's dusk and time to say goodbye!
It was nice hanging around with you, but I have to go before it gets fully dark.
What time is it? I think I have to go.
It's a nice place here, but I will sleep at home. See you!
We will see us next midday!
I don't like the darkness. See you next midday!
A wish you a good night.
I think you miscounted. Not? Oh, yes, sorry.
There is no better way to buy quality stuff.
I hope you have fun with it.
I could give my goods away for free. Could be a nice orc. Could.
Perhaps you should have money, if you try, let me say, if you try to, buy things.
Here is the money. Have fun with it.
If you have more, just sell it to me.
If you have something to sell, just ask.
You could built a hawker post instead.
I hope this is not a trap.
Build hawker posts and I will fly to one nearest to you.
Like a guided rocket, I hit the requested place.
Can we trade a bit now?
So, here I stay for now.
If you want that I come back to this specific place, build a hawker post.
I have a job for you.
I have work with occasional payment.
Do you looking for a little adventure?
You could do something for me, #1.
A task to complete and mostly a reward to gather. How does this sound?
Hey #1! Do you have a moment?
Let's work together, what do you think?
We should extend our relationship, or not?
I know you are the right one!
You will do this, I'm absolute sure!
I'm glad you have the time for it.
Just come back if you completed the job.
What's your progress with the job I gave you?
What's the progress on the job?
Hey, #1! How far do you got with the task?
Were you able to manage it?
I hope you were able to complete the job.
No beer? Are you kidding me?
Okay #1. Funny joke. Where is the beer?
I never saw a tavern without any beer.
At least the tavern has... wait... it hasn't.
Just close the tavern instead letting us walk all the way.
We will not tolerate such a tavern keeper who can't guarantee beer.
It would be nice if there is something like a... how it is called? Yeah. A chair. A damn chair.
I don't like to sit on the ground.
Place chairs near tables. It isn't that hard, I think.
A room with a chair and a table...
I don't like to stand or walk while drinking beer.
I think you forgot some chairs.
A chair without a table is like an orc without a beer or an orc with a beer without a chair.
Can we please have a table? Thank you.
Chairs, okay. But hwere are the tables?
I think you forgot the tables.
Buy tables, they aren't that expensive.
Taverns should have tables all around.
Let's see if the inn got better.
I really hope the tavern doesn't stay that bad.
If only the beer would be good.
Not a good tavern, but let's see if it got better.
The tavern is... how should I say... capable of development.
If the beer gets better, the tavern could get a higher stance.
No good beer. Not a good tavern.
The last time I was here, the beer wasn't that good.
I'm somehow curious how the tavern improved.
Not the best inn, but surely not the worst.
The tavern is okay, but it could be better.
Let's see how the tavern evolved.
I think #1 does his best to improve the tavern. I hope.
The tavern gets better and better, I think.
Better interior or better beer could help.
The tavern is indeed good, but improvable.
The only thing I hate is, that I have to go some time.
There is no better place to relax.
Let's see if the tavern gots even better.
One of the best taverns I know.
The best place to have a good time.
I'm not sure if I just hate the beer or the tavern. It could be both.
I somehow don't like this tavern.
Perhaps I should look for a better inn.
I leave. Nothing to like here.
I wish you the best, but your tavern is just bad.
It was a nice evening, thank you!
I wish you all a good night!
I hope I find my way home.
The tavern has a moderate quality. And good beer, too.
I come back next evening. For sure!
What an evening! What a night!
I have to go, but I will come back!
I'm suprised by the quality of this inn.
You should get awarded from the orcish army for this tavern!
Now let's look for a place.
I hope my favorite chair isn't taken.
I'm looking for a proper place...
After all the hard work, let's have a nice evening.
Walking and drinking could be problematic. But I don't care.
I smell a war. Perhaps this will be one of the last nights with beer in our hands.
#1 is the keeper here, did you know?
... and then I split him in a half. What a picture!
We should all prepare for the next war, after we lost the last one.
How far are the war preparations?
Like a pack of wolves we attacked them from the left.
Do you know that I eat wood sometimes? Especially when I'm bored, so hurry up.
The clan of #3 will visit this tavern!
I keep visiting this tavern. Keep up, #1!
I am #2. Nice to meet you, #1.
The orcish army needs people like you, #1!
I know you do your best.
I used to work in a place like this!
I could never make a brew this good.
You looking for a hire? Probably not.
A shaman bound me once ago into this barrel.
I'm leaving barrel. Do you have a problem with that?
Someone told me I behave creepy.
Don't be scared. I'm a talking barrel which sells beer.
If I tip over, I could roll through the tavern.
I serve beer because I can.
It's getting hot in here. I hate fire.
As I died years ago, I couldn't imagine that I get resurrected in a... barrel.
I'm like a genie in a bottle. Just not that smart.
I just keep talking. Sadly, nobody listens.
I'm bound to this barrel forever.
I sell beer. A beer, anyone?
I give my best in selling beer.
Fill me with beer and I will sell it.
No beer here, I feel so murderous. I mean sorry.
My barrel is empty and I'm mostly abstinent.
No. I didn't drink the beer by myself.
I can't kill you. I mean, I can't help you. Sorry.
Sorry, I have no beer left.
My twines are ready to draw a beer.
What a creepy evening. Do you want a beer?
I always asked myself, how blood tastes. I don't know why.
Let me check if you paid enough.
Some piece of wood has a task for you.
Nice to hear. Thank you for helping.
Were you able to help me?
I am the pink guardian of this forest.
My name is Senn. Are you here to help me protecting the forest?
Kneel down. I am the ruler of this place.... at least I tried it.
I am Senn. The forest called you to help me. I hope.
You will come back. I know.
I am the pink guardian of this forest.
My name is Senn. Are you here to help me protecting the forest?
Kneel down. I am the ruler of this place.... at least I tried it.
I am Senn. The forest called you to help me. I hope.
Thank you for helping me out.
[color=240,176,84]SUNNY![/] The sun shines and everything is fine!
[color=84,240,187]LIGHT RAIN![/] The ground's wetness is increased and rain barrels get filled if outdoor. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=84,240,187]MEDIUM RAIN![/] The ground's wetness is increased and rain barrels get filled if outdoor. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=84,240,187]HEAVY RAIN![/] The ground's wetness is increased and rain barrels get filled if outdoor. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=188,191,191]CLOUDY![/] It's getting a bit cloudy and therefore, bad weather could occur!

[color=84,172,240]LIGHT HAIL![/] It's exhausting to walk outside and the hailstones can damage objects, buildings but primarily plants. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=84,172,240]MEDIUM HAIL![/] It's exhausting to walk outside and the hailstones can damage objects, buildings but primarily plants. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=84,172,240]HEAVY HAIL![/] It's exhausting to walk outside and the hailstones can damage objects, buildings but primarily plants. Visitors will stay at home. The hawker will discontinue his visits.
[color=178,231,240]LIGHT SNOWFALL![/] The ground's wetness is increased. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=178,231,240]MEDIUM SNOWFALL![/] The ground's wetness is increased. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=178,231,240]HEAVY SNOWFALL![/] The ground's wetness is increased. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.

[color=188,191,191]LIGHT STORM![/] The ground's wetness is increased and the windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=188,191,191]MEDIUM STORM![/] The ground's wetness is increased and the windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. Visitors will stay at home. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=188,191,191]HEAVY STORM![/] The ground's wetness is increased and the windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. Visitors will stay at home. The hawker will discontinue his visits.
[color=178,200,240]LIGHT FOG![/] The ground is getting wet. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=178,200,240]MEDIUM FOG![/] The ground is getting wet. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=178,200,240]HEAVY FOG![/] The ground is getting wet. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer.
[color=240,161,84]LIGHT HEAT![/] The ground's wetness and eutrophy is lowered and visitors will stay longer.
[color=240,161,84]MEDIUM HEAT![/] The ground's wetness and eutrophy is lowered and it's exhausting to walk outside. Visitors will stay longer.
[color=240,161,84]HEAVY HEAT![/] The ground's wetness and eutrophy is lowered and it's exhausting to walk outside. Visitors will stay longer.

[color=188,191,191]THUNDERSTORM![/] Oh shit! The ground's wetness is increased and the windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and visitors will stay at home. If a lightning strikes, it can damage plants, objects and buildings! The hawker will discontinue his visits, because hot-air balloons and lightning strikes are mostly a bad combination.

[color=84,172,240]LIGHT BLIZZARD![/] The windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. There are less visitors but the ones who come probably stay longer. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=84,172,240]MEDIUM BLIZZARD![/] The windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. Visitors will stay at home. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=84,172,240]HEAVY BLIZZARD![/] The windbreak is lowered. It's exhausting to walk outside and the storm can damage plants but primarily objects and buildings. Visitors will stay at home. The hawker will discontinue his visits.

[color=84,240,157]Congratulations![/] You increased in your social rank and a new clan heard of your efforts. The clan of #1 (#2 members) wants to visit your inn, [color=84,240,157]but you have to allow it in the hub menu[/] [scale=0.5,true,false][icon=31,147,395,48,45][/].

[color=84,240,143]SPRING[/] of year #! It's the main season for Hop [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,0,0,50,50][/] and Belladonna [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,500,0,50,50][/], therefore they can drop an extra crop on harvest. Furthermore, Hop [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,0,0,50,50][/], Barley [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,150,0,50,50][/], Belladonna [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,500,0,50,50][/] and Sunflowers [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,400,0,50,50][/] grow with their normal speed while all other crops need more time than normal to fully grow.

[color=165,240,84]SUMMER[/] of year #! It's the main season for Barley [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,150,0,50,50][/], Corn [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,50,0,50,50][/], Blueleaves [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,300,0,50,50][/] and Sunflowers [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,400,0,50,50][/], therefore they can drop an extra crop on harvest. Furthermore, Spelt [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,250,0,50,50][/], Corn [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,50,0,50,50][/], Blueleaves [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,300,0,50,50][/] and Dryroot [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,450,0,50,50][/] grow with their normal speed while all other crops need more time than normal to fully grow.

[color=240,84,84]AUTUMN[/] of year #! It's the main season for Cotton [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,550,300,50,50][/], Spelt [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,250,0,50,50][/] and Dryroot [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,450,0,50,50][/], therefore they can drop an extra crop on harvest. Furthermore, Cotton [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,550,300,50,50][/], Rye [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,200,0,50,50][/], Wheat [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,100,0,50,50][/] and Lotus [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,350,0,50,50][/] grow with their normal speed while all other crops need more time than normal to fully grow.

[color=178,231,240]WINTER[/] of year #! It's the main season for Rye [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,200,0,50,50][/], Wheat [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,100,0,50,50][/] and Lotus [scale=0.5,0.5,true,false][icon=28,350,0,50,50][/], therefore they can drop an extra crop on harvest. Plants and trees don't grow during winter!
[color=255,163,96]Warning![/] You decreased in your social rank, because the visiting clan # isn't satisfied anymore.
#1 stopped its production because of missing #2!
# stopped its production because there isn't enough storage!
A pigeon feeding box runs out of food soon.
The pigeon #1 brought back an item (#2) from an exploration tour!
The bad weather may kill your pigeons. It's time to bring them back to the boxes!
The pigeon # died because of bad weather!
The pigeon # died because of a high age!
A new pigeon eclosed! The name of the new member is #.
The pigeon #1 reached level #2 and has new skill points to spend!
The pigeon sleeping box of # runs out of food!

The secret to a GOOD brew is hard work. The secret to a GREAT brew is having someone else do the hard work. Keep the second secret to yourself and you will do just fine.|~The Brew Master
I had a dream that we met again, for the first time, and things were different. Better.|- John
Roses are red,|violets are blue,|I know you are out there,|it's just a matter of finding you.|- Hato
I love you, Sips!|- Stinky Pete, from the Boom Boom Saloon
Roses are red,|Violets are blue,|You are green,|And I love you!|- Djbq
Charmander is red,|Squirtle is blue,|Trubbish is trash,|just like you.|- Unknown
You smell as beautiful as my dung bag.| |Love,|- Bertha!
